body_html:
I think it meant to write a module like Euclidean.lua from lua torch, which also learns some centroids as part of the module. I'm not sure how widespread is the use-case of such a module, but if @soumith is OK that could be added.

Also, note that for simple distance computations we already have F.pairwise_distance.
body_text:
I think it meant to write a module like Euclidean.lua from lua torch, which also learns some centroids as part of the module. I'm not sure how widespread is the use-case of such a module, but if @soumith is OK that could be added.
Also, note that for simple distance computations we already have F.pairwise_distance.
body:
I think it meant to write a module like [`Euclidean.lua` from lua torch](https://github.com/torch/nn/blob/master/Euclidean.lua), which also learns some centroids as part of the module. I'm not sure how widespread is the use-case of such a module, but if @soumith is OK that could be added.

Also, note that for simple distance computations we already have `F.pairwise_distance`.
